Part Four, Chapter 21, Section 4: The Ten Stages of Progression of Vajra Banner Bodhisattva
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give various canopies, namely:
Canopies for venerating people, adorned with various wonderful jewels, the foremost among innumerable boundless ornamented canopies;

With jeweled poles, covered with golden nets, surrounded by jeweled necklaces hanging down, hanging various jeweled bells, slightly moving and slightly knocking against each other with pure lapis lazuli beads, producing harmonious and elegant sounds, bound with white pure jeweled nets, covered above with hundreds of thousands of pure various jeweled nets, adorned with innumerable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­Ä«s of various jewels, fumigated with innumerable koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of sinking sandalwood and solid fragrance, and purely adorned with JambÅ«nada gold.
In this way, with immeasurable, incalculable, nayuta parasols, he practices giving with a mind free from evil, a vast mind, and a mind of abandonment:
Either offering to the present buddhas, or making offerings to stupas after parinirvÄá¹‡a.

In order to seek the Dharma, he makes offerings to bodhisattvas and good and wise advisors, or to Dharma teachers, or to his parents, or to the Saá¹…gha, or he makes offerings to all the Buddha's teachings, or he makes offerings to various blessed fields of merit, or he makes offerings to teachers and those worthy of respect, or he makes offerings to those who have first given rise to the aspiration for enlightenment, or he makes offerings to all the poor and lowly, giving them whatever they seek.
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives parasols, he makes the following aspirations:
May this wholesome root cause all sentient beings to be covered by wholesome roots, and also to be shaded and protected by all buddhas;
May all sentient beings be protected by wisdom and merit, and eliminate the defilements of the world;
May all sentient beings be covered with pure Dharma, and eliminate all the heat and distress of afflictions;
May all sentient beings attain the inner treasury of wisdom of the TathÄgata, and all sentient beings delight in observing without weariness;
May all sentient beings cover themselves with the pure and bright Dharma, and attain the indestructible Buddha Dharma;
May all sentient beings attain the good covering of the body, and ultimately attain the TathÄgata's pure Dharma body;
May all sentient beings become the covering for all, and with the wisdom of the ten powers universally cover the world;
May all sentient beings attain the wisdom according to their inclinations, all surpass all worlds, be pure and clear, and be unstained;
May all sentient beings attain the offering-worthy covering, become the supreme field of blessings, and receive all offerings;
May all sentient beings attain the supreme canopy, naturally awakening to the supreme wisdom canopy.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving canopies, causing all sentient beings to uphold the freely sovereign canopy of the Dharma, to cover all worlds in the Dharma realm and space with a single meritorious canopy, manifesting the freely sovereign spiritual powers of the buddhas, to adorn the Dharma realm with a single meritorious canopy, making offerings to the buddhas, with wonderful banners, pennants, and canopies universally covering all tathÄgatas in the ten directions;
causing all buddha-lands to be adorned with various jeweled canopies;
causing all sentient beings to all happily seek unsurpassed enlightenment, universally covering sentient beings with the unsurpassed canopy;

causing all sentient beings to make offerings to a single buddha with wonderful canopies adorned with inexpressibly inexpressible numbers of all kinds of jewels, and to make offerings to all buddhas in the same way;
May all sentient beings naturally awaken and attain the most correct enlightenment, with merit as vast and subtle as a canopy, universally covering all Buddhas;
May all sentient beings make offerings to all Buddhas in all worlds in the Dharma realm and space with various jeweled canopies;

May all sentient beings use various maá¹‡i jewel canopies, with jeweled necklaces hanging all around as adornments, various solid fragrant canopies, pure mixed jewels as adornments, extremely tall and vast, covered above with a net of white jewels, surrounded by a net of golden bells that naturally emit subtle sounds, and make offerings to all Buddhas with such innumerable canopies;
May all sentient beings attain the unobstructed wisdom canopy, universally covering all Buddhas in the ten directions;
May all sentient beings attain the supreme wisdom canopy, universally covering all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings attain the jeweled canopy adorned with the merits of the Buddhas, covering all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings be fully endowed with the pure great vows and merits of the Buddhas;
May all sentient beings attain the inconceivable pure mind-jewel;
May all sentient beings fulfill the wisdom of mastery over all dharmas;
May all sentient beings use their wholesome roots to universally cover all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings attain the unsurpassed wisdom-canopy, universally covering all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings attain the canopy of the ten powers, universally covering all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings be able to universally cover all dharma realms with a single buddha-land;
May all sentient beings attain mastery over all dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain mental mastery;
May all sentient beings have superior and vast wisdom;
May all sentient beings be able to universally cover all sentient beings with immeasurable merits;
May all sentient beings cover their minds with all kinds of merits;
May all sentient beings universally cover everything with an attitude of equality;
May all sentient beings universally cover everything with great wisdom;
May all sentient beings possess great dedication;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings fulfill a pure and upright mind;
May all sentient beings have a pure faculty of intention.

This is the dedication of wholesome roots when Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give various canopies, causing all sentient beings to fully accomplish the greatest dedication and universally cover and accept all sentient beings.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give various pure banners and flags:

The poles were made of immeasurable various treasures, with banners hanging from various jeweled silks, various brocades hanging all around, a white jeweled net covering above, and a jeweled net of golden bells adorning it. When gently blown by the breeze, it emitted a harmonious and elegant sound. There were innumerable billions of nayutas of wonderful banners and flags as attendants, decorated with various jeweled silks. The half-moon jeweled images were made of JambÅ«nada gold, emitting a great light like the sun illuminating everywhere. The jeweled banners were adorned all over the earth, and the banners were adorned with the karmic rewards of the adornments of all worlds according to one's wishes, abiding in the tathÄgata-ká¹£etra of all the tathÄgatas in the Dharma realm of space.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, wherever they wish in the worlds, universally give wonderful banners, causing them to give rise to the upright mind of enlightenment. They may give to all present buddhas, or give to stÅ«pas, or give to the Dharma Jewel, or give to the Saá¹…gha Jewel, or give to good and wise advisors, or give to bodhisattvas, or give to Å›rÄvakas, or give to pratyekabuddhas, or give to the great assembly, or give to sentient beings, or give to the poor. When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give banners and flags, they make this kind ofè¿´å‘:

Using this wholesome root, they cause all sentient beings to establish the banner of all wholesome roots and merits, which cannot be destroyed;ğŸ”½they cause all sentient beings to establish the banner of mastery over all dharmas, to protect the true Dharma;
they cause all sentient beings to protect the true Dharma Jewel and uphold the profound Dharma of the buddhas and bodhisattvas;
May all sentient beings establish the banner of merit and virtue, light the lamp of wisdom, and illuminate all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings become indestructible banners, subduing all evil deeds of demons;
May all sentient beings establish the banner of the power of wisdom, which cannot be destroyed by any demon;
May all sentient beings attain the banner of the excellent NÄrÄyaá¹‡a wisdom, destroying all worldly banners;
May all sentient beings establish the banner of the sun of liberation wisdom, their wisdom replete, illuminating the Dharma realm;
May all sentient beings attain the banner adorned with the jewel of wisdom, filling all buddha-lands with unspeakable, wondrous banners, making offerings to all buddhas in the ten directions;
May all sentient beings attain the TathÄgata's banner, destroying all ninety-six kinds of heretical views.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving banners and flags, causing all sentient beings to establish the banner of bodhisattva practices that are lofty, vast, and profound, to establish the banner of all bodhisattva sovereign practices, and to attain the pure path.
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva opens up a treasury of various jewels and practices giving, he makes this kind of dedication:
With these wholesome roots, may all sentient beings always see the Buddha-jewel, abandon delusion, and cultivate right mindfulness;
May all sentient beings attain the illumination of the Dharma-jewel and protect and uphold the Dharma-treasury of all buddhas;
May all sentient beings embrace the Sangha-jewel, abandon stinginess, and be generous to fill their minds;
May all sentient beings attain the mind-jewel of sarvajÃ±a, and in the pure bodhi-mind not regress;
May all sentient beings cross over to the jewel of wisdom, forever abandon delusion, and ultimately attain the Buddha-Dharma;
May all sentient beings attain the precious virtues of bodhisattvas and expound the wondrous treasures of wisdom;
May all sentient beings praise the precious virtues of the Buddha and cultivate the wisdom of the ten powers to attain perfect enlightenment;
May all sentient beings attain the sixteen precious wisdoms, enter samÄdhi, and ultimately increase the precious wisdom;
May all sentient beings attain the supreme precious field of merit and awaken to the unsurpassed wisdom treasure of the TathÄgata;
May all sentient beings become the supreme treasure, with inexhaustible eloquence, expounding the precious Dharma.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving various treasures, causing all sentient beings to be fully endowed with the unsurpassed wisdom treasure and attain the unobstructed, pure eye treasure of the Buddha.
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives away his adornments to sentient beings, namely:

all kinds of adornments for the body, adornments for the limbs, adornments for purifying the body, insatiable adornments, and adornments of various precious necklaces - with such innumerable billions of adornments, they give them all, dedicating the wholesome roots:

May all sentient beings have pure and adorned bodies, regard all equally as if they were their only child, transcend the world, attain the bliss of Buddha-knowledge, tame sentient beings, delight them in the profound Dharma, and abide in all Buddha Dharmas;

May all sentient beings be adorned by gods and humans, and adorn themselves with pure wisdom;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings have pure and adorned bodies, and be fully endowed with the pure marks of merit;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings have bodies adorned with wondrous characteristics, and adorn themselves with the marks of a hundred merits;
May all sentient beings have complete bodily characteristics, and adorn themselves with all the marks of virtue;
May all sentient beings have well-adorned speech, all endowed with inexhaustible eloquence;
May all sentient beings have adorned sounds with various merits, with pure and subtle Brahma-like voices;
May all sentient beings delight in the adornments of the Buddha's teachings, listen to and accept the true Dharma, and delight the Buddhas;
May all sentient beings adorn themselves with the adornments of the mind, and in the samÄdhi of mindfulness of the Buddha, see all Buddhas;
May all sentient beings adorn themselves with the adornments of various dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, attain the illumination of the Buddha's teachings, and see the Buddhas' teachings;
May all sentient beings adorn their minds with the adornments of impartial wisdom, and adorn their Dharma bodies with the wisdom of the TathÄgata.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving all kinds of ornaments, to enable all sentient beings to be replete with the adornments of the Buddha's immeasurable Dharma, merit, and wisdom, and to cause all sentient beings to abandon arrogance, conceit, and heedlessness.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, as coronated great kings with sovereign power, give away the bright pearl in their topknot, providing for all, embracing sentient beings, nurturing the mind of giving, perfuming their minds with giving, heading towards superior giving, cultivating wisdom through giving, cultivating the faculty of abandonment through giving, and cultivating extensive enlightenment through giving,
when bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give away the bright pearl in their topknot, they dedicate it in the following way:
May this wholesome root enable all sentient beings to well receive the consecration of omniscience and become Dharma kings;
may all sentient beings be replete with the mark of the topknot, attain the supreme wisdom-topknot, and reach the other shore;
may all sentient beings attain the jewel of supreme wisdom and perfect the summit of all merits;
May all sentient beings be able to abide in the summit of wisdom and be worthy of receiving the respectful bowing of all;
May all sentient beings wear the heavenly crown of wisdom and attain mastery over all dharmas;
May all sentient beings tie the bright pearl of wisdom to their crowns, and no one in the world will be able to see the top of their heads;
May all sentient beings be worthy of receiving the respectful bowing of all, fully endowed with the wisdom crown, illuminating the Buddha's teachings;
May all sentient beings wear the crown of the ten powers on their crowns, with the pure treasury of the ocean of wisdom jewels fully complete;

May all sentient beings abide in the supreme great earth emperor, crush the crowns of all demons, attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and ultimately be fully endowed with the TathÄgata's ten powers;
May all sentient beings attain the supreme crown of victory, and with the wisdom crown, emit the most supreme light.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the roots of goodness from giving away celestial crowns and luminous pearls, causing all sentient beings' supreme and wonderful wisdom to be completely pure and to attain the crown of the pure wisdom maá¹‡i jewel.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see sentient beings in prison suffering various torments:

They may be bound, beaten, confined in dark places, shackled, fettered, whipped, their blood flowing, hungry and thirsty beyond endurance, naked and emaciated, their hair disheveled covering their bodies, suffering immeasurable hardships, with no one to save them.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see such suffering sentient beings, they may give away their wealth, wives, children, and relatives, or give away their own bodies, to rescue suffering sentient beings in those prisons, like the Bodhisattva of Great Compassion and the Bodhisattva King of Good Eyes.
After rescuing sentient beings from those prisons, they provide them with whatever they need.

Or using medicine and spells to bring them peace and comfort, first causing them to rejoice, and then expounding the Dharma for them, establishing them all in the wholesome roots of heedfulness, their minds not turning back from the Dharma of right enlightenment.
When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas rescue people from prison, they make this kind of aspiration:
May this wholesome root cause all sentient beings to be liberated from the bonds of craving;
may all sentient beings cut off the flow of birth and death and reach the other shore of wisdom;
may all sentient beings destroy the darkness of delusion and attain clear and pure wisdom, uprooting the various defilements and leaving behind all dust and impurities;
may all sentient beings sever the bonds of the three realms and attain omniscience;
may all sentient beings forever extinguish the defilements and attain the ground free from afflictions, with unobstructed wisdom all ultimately reaching the other shore;
may all sentient beings be free from the bonds of craving and conceit, ultimately accomplishing the wisdom of being free from craving and conceit;
May all sentient beings be freed from the bonds of desire, forever free from worldly greed and desire, and abide in the world without attachment.
May all sentient beings attain a pure and profound mind, always protected by the buddhas.
May all sentient beings attain an unattached and unfettered mind, vast like the Dharma realm, and ultimate like space.
May all sentient beings attain the spiritual powers of bodhisattvas, roam throughout the lands, tame sentient beings, abandon the world, and abide in the Great Vehicle.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots in order to save suffering sentient beings, causing all sentient beings to ultimately reach the ground of the TathÄgata's wisdom.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see prisoners being led to the execution ground, bound in five ways, their hearts filled with distress, their lives about to end, surrounded by many people, abandoning all the pleasures of JambudvÄ«pa, forever separated from their loved ones, gradually approaching the place of death;
Or impaled on a high pole, cut with knives, burned in fire, or wrapped in oil-soaked cloth and set ablaze, they undergo such immeasurable suffering.

Having seen this, the bodhisattva mahÄsattvas give up their own lives to save them from suffering, just as the great bodhisattvas such as Bodhisattva Dhá¹›timati and Bodhisattva ViÅ›eá¹£agÄmin, by giving up their own bodies and enduring various tortures, save sentient beings, saying:
I will give up my body to replace their lives. Even if the pain is immeasurable, I will endure it all on their behalf and enable them to be liberated.
They further think:
To see such suffering and not replace it would be to lose great benefit.
Why is this?
Because I am for the sake of sentient beings, to save sentient beings, I arouse the mind of omniscience and enlightenment. Therefore, I give up my body to replace their lives.
When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas rescue suffering people, they make such dedications:
With these wholesome roots, may they enable all sentient beings to attain inexhaustible life and body, forever free from the burning of sorrow, grief, and suffering;
May they enable all sentient beings to abide in reliance on the buddhas, to receive the prediction of the power of omniscience and enlightenment;
May they enable all sentient beings to rescue from fear and forever leave the evil destinies;
May they enable all sentient beings to attain all life and forever enter the realm of wisdom of immortality;
May they enable all sentient beings to be free from enemies and always be protected by the Buddha's good and virtuous friends;
May they enable all sentient beings to abandon weapons and cultivate pure karma;
May they enable all sentient beings to be free from fear and, sitting under the bodhi tree, subdue the demon army;
May they enable all sentient beings to be free from the fear of the great assembly and, in the unsurpassed Dharma, attain pure fearlessness and the great lion's roar;
May all sentient beings attain unobstructed lion-like wisdom and practice pure karma.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots from personally giving up their life to save those prisoners, in order to enable all sentient beings to be free from the suffering of birth and death and ultimately attain the bliss of the Buddha.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see people come begging for their skin-covered hair on the top of the head and the bright pearl in their topknot, the bodhisattvas joyfully give them away, like the bodhisattvas Great Jewel Topknot and Excellent Destination and other great bodhisattvas;

When people beg for their skin-covered hair on the top of the head and the bright pearl, they contemplate with the right mind, do not think of other activities, leave behind all worldly affairs, and are solely devoted to tranquility and purity. With right mindfulness and omniscience, they cultivate the mind of rightness and straightforwardness;

At that time, the Bodhisattva took a sharp knife, cut off his skin, hair, and the bright pearl of the topknot, touched his right knee to the ground, joined his palms respectfully, and with a right mind, contemplated the practices of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the three times, giving rise to great joy. With a pure mind, the roots of goodness that filled his sense faculties did not consider suffering;
Suffering is a dharma of birth and cessation, a dharma of impermanence.
Having had this thought, he eliminated all suffering, joyfully made the offering, and dedicated the roots of goodness, thinking:
May all sentient beings attain the appearance of the invisible crown of the head and accomplish the venerable stupa of the Bodhisattva's topknot;
May all sentient beings attain dark blue hair, attain vajra hair, attain soft hair, and be able to eliminate all afflictions;
May all sentient beings attain hair that is not disheveled and hair that is lustrous;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings attain soft hair that curls to the right;
May all sentient beings attain hair that curls to the right;
May all sentient beings attain the Buddha's hair, and may all afflictions and habitual tendencies be completely eradicated;
May all sentient beings emit great light from their hair, illuminating the ten directions;
May all sentient beings attain the Buddha's pure and undisturbed hair;
May all sentient beings attain the hair of a worthy one's stupa, eliminate evil thoughts, and see the TathÄgata's hair;
May all sentient beings' hair be free from all dust and defilements, and attain the TathÄgata's unattached and unfettered hair.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the roots of goodness from giving away the hair on top of the head and the bright pearl in the topknot, in order to enable all sentient beings to ultimately attain all dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, all samÄdhi gates, the cognition of all modes of existence, and the ten powers of the Buddha.

When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give away their eyes, they should cultivate the mind of giving eyes like the Bodhisattva of Joy, the Bodhisattva King of Full Moon, and countless other great bodhisattvas when they give away their eyes. They should cultivate the mind of giving eyes, the mind of the eye of wisdom, the mind of attaining the eye of the Buddha's teachings, the mind heading towards the unsurpassed path, the mind of ultimately perfecting the supernormal knowledges, the mind solely seeking wisdom, and the mind of equally practicing giving as bodhisattvas of the three times.
They should regard those who beg for their eyes with loving eyes, and give them their eyes with a mind of indestructible faith.
This causes the eye of the Buddha to arise, and increases the mind of the great vehicle of bodhi, great compassion, and taming the six sense faculties.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate such a mind, and with the gift of eyes, they always happily give, establish the true Dharma, abandon worldly joy and indulgence, become disgusted with the five desires, delight in the bodhi mind, and fulfill all their wishes according to their requests. They cultivate equal and non-dual giving, and are able to give whatever is needed. They dedicate the wholesome roots,
causing all sentient beings to attain eyes that are opened and bright, becoming the eyes of the world;
causing all sentient beings to attain unobstructed eyes, opening the treasury of vast wisdom;
causing all sentient beings to attain pure physical eyes, which cannot be destroyed by anything in the world;
causing all sentient beings to attain pure heavenly eyes, seeing the deaths and rebirths of all;
causing all sentient beings to attain pure Dharma eyes, able to enter in accordance with the realm of the TathÄgata;
causing all sentient beings to attain pure wisdom eyes, discriminating and understanding all worlds;
May all sentient beings attain the pure Buddha-eye and be able to awaken to all dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain the universally pure eye, with unobstructed ultimate realms;
May all sentient beings eliminate the obscurations of delusion and attain the pure eye, understanding that the realm of sentient beings is empty and nonexistent;
May all sentient beings attain the unobstructed eye and reach the supreme stage of the TathÄgata's ten powers.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the wholesome roots from giving eyes, causing all sentient beings to attain the eye of omniscience.

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives ears, like King ViÅ›iá¹£á¹­a and Bodhisattva ViÅ›iá¹£á¹­a, when giving ears, cultivating bodhisattva practices, being born in the TathÄgata's family, cultivating the giving practiced by the buddhas, correctly recollecting all bodhisattvas' pure practices, following the buddhas' enlightenment, giving rise to the merit and wisdom of pure faculties, observing the world without any solidity;
May all sentient beings always see all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, be unattached to their own bodies, and follow the correct mindfulness of all Buddha-dharmas.

When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their ears, their minds are tranquil, they subdue their faculties, rescue sentient beings from dangerous wildernesses, give rise to the light of wisdom and merit, accomplish the ocean of the perfection of giving, fulfill the mind of giving, know the meaning and the Dharma, clearly understand the various paths, attain the practice of wisdom, and have mastery over the Dharma. They exchange their impermanent body for a permanent body.
When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their ears, they make the following aspirations:
May this wholesome root enable all sentient beings to attain unobstructed ears, be able to universally hear the immeasurable sounds of the Dharma, and thoroughly understand without obstruction;
may all sentient beings attain unobstructed ears and discern the immeasurable sounds;
may all sentient beings attain ears without resistance and attain the pure ears of the Buddha;
May all sentient beings attain pure ears and understand that the ear faculty is empty and non-existent;
May all sentient beings attain vast ears, all completely tranquil, with no arising of consciousness;

May all sentient beings attain ears equal to the dharma realm, able to skillfully hear and uphold all the Buddha's teachings;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings attain unattached ears, able to discern all unobstructed dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain indestructible ears, with no one able to destroy them through heterodox arguments;
May all sentient beings attain all-pervading ears, vast and pure;
May all sentient beings attain the divine ear and the Buddha's ear.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the wholesome roots when giving ears, in order to enable all sentient beings to attain pure ears.
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives his nose, he dedicates in this way:

May all sentient beings attain the nose of the TathÄgata, attain a well-proportioned nose, attain a pleasing nose, attain a pure nose, attain a nose that accords with conditions, attain a high and beautiful nose, attain a nose that subdues enemies, attain the nose of the TathÄgata;

May all sentient beings attain a face with a perfect mouth, attain the door of all dharmas, attain the unobstructed door, attain the door of skillful manifestation, attain the door of non-discontent, attain the door of purity, attain the door of freedom from evil, attain the perfect face and mouth of the tathÄgatas, attain all doors, attain the door of skillful enjoyment and immeasurability.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of merit when giving the nose, wishing that all sentient beings will ultimately enter the Dharma of the buddhas;
May all sentient beings embrace the true Dharma of the buddhas of the ten directions;
May all sentient beings deeply understand and distinguish the wondrous Dharma of the buddhas;
May all sentient beings reach the other shore of the Dharma of the buddhas;
May all sentient beings always see the buddhas;
May all sentient beings attain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the tathÄgatas;
May all sentient beings attain ultimate purity;
May all sentient beings attain the buddhas' Dharma illumination, illuminating all dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain the adornment and purity of buddha-lands;
May all sentient beings attain the buddhas' firm and indestructible bodies.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of merit when giving the nose.

When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in the stage of the great king of self-mastery, they are able to give their teeth to sentient beings, like Bodhisattva Flower Teeth King and Bodhisattva Six-tusked White Elephant King when they give their teeth, they attain a difficult-to-obtain mind, a pure mind of giving like the udumbara flower, an inexhaustible mind of giving, an untainted mind of giving, an unattached mind of giving, an immeasurable mind of giving, a mind of taming and abandoning the faculties, a mind of giving everything, a mind of vowing for omniscience, a mind of bringing peace to sentient beings, a mind of accomplishing giving, a great mind of giving, and a superior mind of giving.
The most important part of the body is the teeth, which are cherished by oneself and admired by others, yet one is able to give them to beggars.
When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in this Dharma and give their teeth, they make the following dedication:
With this wholesome root, may they cause all sentient beings to obtain white and sharp teeth, become the most supreme stupa, and receive offerings from gods and humans;
may all sentient beings attain the Buddha's even and close-set teeth;
may all sentient beings practice a subdued mind and progress towards the perfections of the bodhisattvas;
may all sentient beings have pure teeth, clearly revealing whiteness;
may all sentient beings remember to adorn their mouths, with teeth appearing fresh and clean;
may all sentient beings have forty teeth, always emitting immeasurable pure and wonderful fragrance;
may all sentient beings attain the adornment of teeth and flowers that abide in stability, able to subdue the mind;
may all sentient beings attain pure teeth, able to emit immeasurable thousands of myriads of lights, fresh and complete, illuminating the ten directions;
may all sentient beings attain teeth that slowly chew, when food enters the mouth, each grain is crushed, without any attachment to taste, becoming the supreme field of blessings;
may all sentient beings attain supreme teeth, emitting lights of immeasurable colors, bestowing the prediction of enlightenment.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the roots of goodness when giving teeth, causing all sentient beings to attain unobstructed adornments and the wisdom of all dharmas.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, when people come and beg for their tongues, with soft
words, loving words, and compassionate words, give rise to a comforting mind, like the bodhisattva Good Mouth
King, the bodhisattva Irreversible, and other innumerable bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, etc., when
in the various destinies they undergo innumerable births, those who beg for their tongues first place the beggars in the seat of the
lion's seat, when giving up their tongues, with a joyful mind, an indestructible mind, a mind without resentment
, a great mind, a mind born in the Buddha's family, a mind establishing the bodhisattva family, an untainted mind,
a mind of courageous and diligent progress, a mind not attached to one's own body, a mind without enemies, with the right knee
touching the ground, showing the tongue, speaking soft words, loving words, and compassionate words
saying to the beggar:
'You may take my tongue and use it as you wish, to fulfill your intentions.'
